official-title.#text:
To protect individual privacy against unwarranted
		  governmental intrusion through the use of the unmanned aerial vehicles commonly
		  called drones, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Preserving Freedom from Unwarranted
			 Surveillance Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, a person or entity acting under the authority of the United States
			 shall not use a drone to gather evidence or other information pertaining to
			 criminal conduct or conduct in violation of a regulation except to the extent
			 authorized in a warrant issued under the procedures described in the Federal
			 Rules of Criminal Procedure.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Preserving Freedom from Unwarranted Surveillance Act of 2013/s:3

text.#text:
This Act does not prohibit any of the
			 following:

The use of a drone to patrol national borders to prevent
			 or deter illegal entry of any immigrants or illegal substances.

The use of a
			 drone by a law enforcement party when exigent circumstances exist. For the
			 purposes of this paragraph, exigent circumstances exist when the law
			 enforcement party possesses reasonable suspicion that under particular
			 circumstances, swift action to prevent imminent danger to life or serious
			 damage to property, or to forestall the imminent escape of a suspect, or
			 destruction of evidence.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines credible
			 intelligence indicates there is such a risk.

text.#text:
The use of a drone to
			 counter a high risk of a terrorist attack by a specific individual or
			 organization, when the

Any aggrieved party
			 may in a civil action obtain all appropriate relief to prevent or remedy a
			 violation of this Act.

term.#tail:
means any
			 powered, aerial vehicle that does not carry a human operator, uses aerodynamic
			 forces to provide vehicle lift, can fly autonomously or be piloted remotely,
			 can be expendable or recoverable, and can carry a lethal or nonlethal payload.

means a person or entity authorized by law to
			 investigate or prosecute offenses against the United States.
